snippet: Robert Wiesenthal will become chief executive of Blade, an on-demand app service he co-founded that shuttles customers by helicopter and small plane.
abstract: Robert Wiesenthal plans to resign post as chief operating officer of Warner Music Group to become chairman and chief executive of Blade; company, which was co-founded by Wiesenthal, provides on-demand helicopter and small plane services that have already attracted some 22,000 customers.
lead_paragraph: Robert Wiesenthal will become chief executive of Blade, an on-demand app service he co-founded that shuttles customers by helicopter and small plane.

headline.main: Warner Music Executive Is Leaving to Lead Helicopter Start-Up Blade
headline.print_headline: Warner Music Executive to Lead Copter Start-Up
